item.title: Compiling OpenSSL 1.0 for Older Package Versions
item.description: Running older versions of software is always a pain. There will be missing libraries, compilation errors and what not. These issues can be mitigated little by using a package manager that manages the different versions of the software. But most package managers such as asdf download the source (yea OSS) and compile on your machine. Most of the tools and libraries work really good, but there is one error that keeps coming again and again.
